channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.description: Amber Heard texted her mother in 2013 that she was heartbroken after Johnny Depp became violent, London's High Court hears.
item.title: 'He's nuts': Heard shared fears about Depp in 2013, court told

item.description: Mayor Ted Wheeler scrambled to put on goggles while denouncing what he called the "urban warfare" tactic of federal agents in his city.
item.title: 'It's got to stop now': Federal officers hit Portland mayor with tear gas

item.dc:creator: Bevan Shields
item.description: Ziad Akle has become the first person sent to prison in the Unaoil corruption scandal first exposed by The Age and The Sydney Morning Herald.
item.title: 'Justice for the Iraqi people': Unaoil executive jailed in massive oil corruption scandal

item.dc:creator: Rachel Clun
item.description: The clusters have prompted NSW Minister and Bega MP Andrew Constance to urge Sydneysiders to stay away from his region.
item.title: 'No time for a beachside holiday': Fears about COVID outbreak as more cases confirmed

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: Queensland government debt is set to blow out to over $100 billion dollars as the pandemic takes a sledgehammer to the state's bottom line.
item.title: 'No alternative': COVID-19 pushes Queensland’s debt past $100 billion

item.dc:creator: Chris Barrett
item.description: As NRL officials become increasingly frustrated at the time taken to finalise the Cronulla centre's drugs case, he has received support from the swimmer about enduring the anti-doping process.
item.title: 'She understands': Shayna Jack reaches out to Bronson Xerri over drug ban

item.dc:creator: Georgina Robinson
item.description: New Zealand wanted to have its new competition signed and sealed by the end of next month but Australia has other ideas.
item.title: Expression of no interest: Australia to rebuff New Zealand competition invitation

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: The Queensland winter is helping fatten up the strawberries and inject extra sweetness into the fruit after three years of bitterness.
item.title: Queensland strawberries bounce back after COVID-19, needles, drought

item.dc:creator: Angus Thompson
item.description: Public spaces have become a premium during the COVID-19 pandemic, with one inner west council fighting to hold onto land it fears could be lost to development.
item.title: 'Unique opportunity': Plea to use RSL site as COVID-19 outdoor space

item.dc:creator: Jordan Baker
item.description: School students should curate an education passport that focuses on skills and knowledge instead of worrying about how to lift their ATAR, a new national report says.
item.title: Call for 'learner profile' of students to end dominance of ATAR

item.dc:creator: Fergus Hunter
item.description: The sweeping legislation reaches beyond China's territory and academics warn it could put Hongkongers at Australia's universities at risk.
item.title: Hong Kong security law presents free speech test for Australian universities

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Friday, July 24

item.dc:creator: Patrick Hatch
item.description: A group of major Tabcorp investors combined forces to demand the removal of chief executive David Attenborough and chairman Paula Dwyer.
item.title: Tabcorp investors called for CEO's head before leadership overhaul

item.description: If you examine the research, it appears managers should be "curious, not furious" when facing anger from employees.
item.title: Why it’s OK to get angry at work

item.dc:creator: Anthony Galloway
item.description: Security agencies are concerned the number of child abuse reports received by authorities will dive if Facebook's plans to encrypt communications across its products goes ahead.
item.title: Facebook accounts for up to 60% of child abuse reports to AFP, data shows

item.dc:creator: Michaela Whitbourn
item.description: NSW Attorney-General Mark Speakman says an existing public interest defence "never works" for mass media outlets.
item.title: Defamation law set for overhaul to protect public interest journalism

item.description: With the budget deficit being compared to that of post-World War II, we need the same post-war initiatives and vision to drive new industries and create jobs.
item.title: Amid the financial carnage, rare opportunity knocks

item.description: Our ever-expanding online lives are putting our brain health and broader well-being at risk.
item.title: Curb your screen time and you improve mental health

item.dc:creator: Zoe Samios
item.description: Netflix and YouTube are no longer reducing the video quality of their programming, renewing concerns about congested telco networks.
item.title: Telcos tackle traffic spikes Netflix brings streaming back up to speed

item.description: I have first class honors in biotechnology and a PhD in chemical engineering but can't get a science job.
item.title: I have a PhD but can't seem to find any kind of work

item.description: Amid rising cases of anti-Semitism, the NSW Jewish Board of Deputies reported vile posts on its Facebook page - and the perpetrator soon received a visit from police.
item.title: When hateful racism becomes this shocking, police do go knocking

item.description: Forty five years ago, the Premier of NSW, Mr Tom Lewis, opened the Waterfall to Bulli tollway, which cut the old 40 minute driving time to just 12 minutes.
item.title: From the Archives, 1975 : Waterfall to Bulli tollway opened

item.description: Michala Banas is a New Zealand-born, multi-award winning actor and screen intimacy co-ordinator.
item.title: On my mind: actor Michala Banas marvels about Briggs and Mrs Maisel

item.dc:creator: Samantha Hutchinson
item.description: Victorian Premier Daniel Andrews has a problem, and it’s not just the state’s COVID-19 infection rate.
item.title: Leaky ships are quick to sink

item.description: Mask-wearing style varies; there’s the medical-grade close fit, the casual light scarf and when the wearer needs to eat or drink – the chin mask.
item.title: Weirdly, we're getting used to (all kinds of) masks almost overnight

item.dc:creator: Clay Lucas
item.description: Deal by state with developer to build new private homes on a former public housing site may lead to cash windfall for company, due to delays caused by asbestos.
item.title: Private deal on public housing may hand developer big payout for delay

item.description: The latest work by Sydney Morning Herald editorial cartoonist Cathy Wilcox.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Cathy Wilcox

item.dc:creator: Latika Bourke
item.description: Hundreds of Nick Cave fans are demanding refunds after the global online streaming event was plagued with buffering and freezing glitches.
item.title: Nick Cave's global streaming concert hit by technical issues

item.description: Some of his best work
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Andrew Dyson

item.description: Illustrations by the artist from The Age.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Matt Golding

item.dc:creator: Anthony Colangelo
item.description: The Bulldogs announced on Thursday that Hunter was taking a break two games after returning from a four-match suspension for alleged breaches of Victoria's coronavirus restrictions.
item.title: Hunter's absence not 'a longer term' one: Beveridge

item.description: Gallery of illustrations by Sydney Morning Herald artist, Simon Letch.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Simon Letch

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, July 24, 2020

item.dc:creator: Jewel Topsfield
item.description: The company called in to contain the deadly COVID-19 outbreak at Sydney's Newmarch House has been deployed to the site of Victoria's worst aged care home cluster.
item.title: St Basil's aged care workers raise infection control concerns

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: While Scott Morrison and Josh Frydenberg face many vexing economic policy dilemmas, JobKeeper has emerged as the government’s biggest electoral asset.
item.title: No government has been mugged by reality quite like this

item.dc:creator: Anthony Colangelo
item.description: The Western Bulldogs withstood an absolute barrage to outlast a rampant and smart Gold Coast in the wet.
item.title: Suns relish prime-time footy, but the Dogs come out on top

item.dc:creator: Damien Ractliffe
item.description: Alligator Blood has been stripped of his Magic Millions 3YO Guineas win and trainer David Vandyke has been fined $20,000 after the gelding tested positive to prohibited substance altrenogest.
item.title: Alligator Blood disqualified, trainer fined $20,000

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted in the work of our award-winning cartoonists.
item.title: Today's cartoons: The illustrated news

item.dc:creator: Christian Nicolussi
item.description: Parramatta triumphed 26-16 to return to the top of the NRL ladder, but it was impossible to ignore the sight of Michael Chee Kam convulsing after a concussion.
item.title: Sickening Michael Chee Kam concussion overshadows gritty Eels win

item.dc:creator: Michael Lynch
item.description: AFL players might be worried about a fixture pile up, but that's nothing to what A-League players have had to go through playing in the Asian Champions League.
item.title: AFL players doing it hard with fixture pile-up? You must be joking

item.dc:creator: Greg Baum
item.description: Friday would have been the day of the opening ceremony of the now postponed Tokyo Olympics. The athletes will pause, but not for long.
item.title: It should have been the start of the Olympics. Instead, ready, set ... wait

item.dc:creator: Adam Pengilly
item.description: There's been plenty of talk around Parramatta's Ryan Matterson in the lead-up to this one but it's his former side who are the outsiders as round 11 kicks off.
item.title: NRL 2020 LIVE: Parramatta host Wests Tigers in Bankwest grudge match

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, July 23, 2020

item.description: All the ins and outs for round eight of the AFL premiership season.
item.title: Round eight AFL teams and expert tips

item.dc:creator: Matt Bungard
item.description: Victorian face mask mandate begins as state anticipates a further spike in COVID-19 cases.
item.title: As the day unfolded: Victoria records 403 new COVID-19 cases and five deaths; Josh Frydenberg reveals Australia's biggest budget deficit since World War II

item.description: The devastated family of 13-year-old Kate Savage have said their final goodbyes at Royal Perth Hospital, after the teenager tragically took her own life earlier this week.
item.title: Kate's legacy the only comfort for heartbroken Perth family fighting for more support

item.dc:creator: Tony Moore
item.description: One hundred and thirteen people have drowned in Queensland waters in the past 20 years. Only five of them were wearing a life jacket.
item.title: Queenslanders ignoring life jackets as death toll grows

item.description: Coins in the bag, and channelling cattle.
item.title: Two Bob and puggle survive the flood

item.description: Bill Barclay was a prominent psychiatrist responsible for all hospitals in NSW when Medibank arrived.
item.title: Doctor helped psychiatry shed Dickensian reputation

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: UQ researchers have found the honey from native stingless bees contains a rare type of sugar that matches many of the health claims made about it.
item.title: Scientists say native stingless bee honey hits the sweet spot
